snippet: Farmers have long believed that landowners controlled groundwater, but the state legislature passed new controls that establish a framework for managing water withdrawals through local agencies.
abstract: California Gov Jerry Brown is expected to sign measures making drought-plagued California the last Southwestern state to establish groundwater controls; sweeping legislation does not eliminate private ownership, but establishes framework for managing groundwater withdrawals through local agencies; new legal framework also requires that state step in if local authorities fail to manage their aquifers in a sustainable manner.
lead_paragraph: Farmers have long believed that landowners controlled groundwater, but the state legislature passed new controls that establish a framework for managing water withdrawals through local agencies.

headline.main: Desperately Dry California Tries to Curb Private Drilling for Water
headline.print_headline: Desperately Dry California Tries to Curb Private Drilling for Water
